trans-unit.source: Defines the property and event a control implements to act as a check box.
The ICheckBoxControl interface defines the property and event that must be implemented for a control to act as a check box on a Web page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ICheckBoxControl.Checked%2A> property can be used to determine whether the check box is selected or to set the property programmatically.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ICheckBoxControl.CheckedChanged> event is raised when the <xref:System.Web.UI.ICheckBoxControl.Checked%2A> value changes between posts to the server.
Gets or sets the value of an <xref href="System.Web.UI.ICheckBoxControl"></xref> control that indicates whether the control is selected.
Controls implementing <xref:System.Web.UI.ICheckBoxControl> use Checked to determine whether the control is selected, or to set the value programmatically.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the check box is selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ICheckBoxControl.Checked*> property changes between posts to the server.
The CheckedChanged event is raised when the value of <xref:System.Web.UI.ICheckBoxControl.Checked%2A> changes between posts to the server.
